title.narrative: Somalia Country Programme Thematic Programme 3: Somali Compact Financing Windows

description.narrative:
The objective is to support relevant programming through multi-donor financing mechanisms that advance Somalia Compact results in Peace and Statebuiding Goals (PSG) with key focus on three PSGs; inclusive politics (PSG1), economic foundations (PSG4) and revenue-raising and service delivery (PSG 5). The objective reflects Denmark's commitment and strategy to support the Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) together with the Federal Member States (FMS) and Government of Somaliland (GOSL) development and to use multi-donor funds for more efficient and effecive programming, with closer links to government and country system.
The nascent FGS and GOSL inistitutions are major target for support, as they are the building blocks for state formation and economic recovery that will reach across the country to keep people safe and assure their rights and well- being.

title.narrative: 1. Number of regular donor coordination meetings conducted by the United Nations
Target: 100% Result: 100% - All projects consulted with PSG working groups / PWGs
3. % of Danida Somalia Country Programme funds going into multi-partner, government-led funds

Target: No specific target Result: 63% in 2017
In 2017: DKK 285 million to multi-partner, government-led funds constitute 63% of total Country Programme budget (450M), and 71% of funds implemented through partners (399M). Original intention was “more than 50%”.
1. Number of regular donor coordination meetings conducted by the United Nations
Target: One meeting per month Result: No data - The UN-MPTF Annual Report is not reporting against this indicator.
